{{shiremonths}}
The third month of the [[Shire Calendar]], lying between [[Solmath]] and [[Astron]], and approximately corresponding to modern [[21 February]] through [[22 March]].<ref>{{App|Calendars}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name represents a [[Hobbitish|modernization]] of the [[Old English]] name for March, ''[[wiktionary:hreþmonaþ|Hreþmōnaþ]]'', meaning "rough-month".<ref>{{webcite|articleurl=http://www.forodrim.org/daeron/md_smn.html|articlename=The Shire month-names|author=[[Arden R. Smith]]|website=[http://www.forodrim.org/daeron Mellonath Daeron - The Language Guild of the Forodrim]}}</ref>

Alternatively, the name could mean "Storm-month", according to Dr. Eleanor Parker's reading of [[J.R.R. Tolkien|J.R.R. Tolkien's]] commentary on the word "Hreðmanna" in [[Beowulf: A Translation and Commentary]].<ref>{{webcite|articleurl=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EDqeq_Iiba0&t=525s|articlename=Tolkien and the Anglo-Saxon Calendar|author=Dr. Eleanor Parker|website=[https://www.youtube.com/@TolkienOxford50 Tolkien 50th Anniversary Seminar Series on YouTube]|accessed=20 June 2024}}</ref>
